name: unrealizable
content:
unrealizable adjective
(NOT POSSIBLE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
not able to be achieved: Owning a home of their own seemed like a totally unrealizable dream. Some fear they are creating unrealisable expectations. Synonym
unachievable
More examplesFewer examplesHe is making promises which are unrealizable, unrealistic and unfunded.They argued that the ideas in the book were mere abstract theories, unrealizable in practice.He acknowledges that such an ideal was unrealizable at that time.

unrealizable adjective
(MONEY)
finance & economics
  specialized not able to be sold to get money: Some people are sitting on sizeable assets which are unrealisable.
More examplesFewer examplesIn the case of a loan, there might be the risk of the collateral being unrealizable.They were accused of dumping unrealizable subprime debt in the feeder funds.He will receive foreign currency of a quite uncertain and possibly unrealizable value.
